page.title: 07BLACKSMITH CONTINUED
page.content:
Mr Laidlaw said it took him five years to train as a blacksmith but now he is more of a farrier. His forge is housed in a small barn which has been there for many years.
The area served by Mr Laidlaw includes {Christchurch, Ringwood, Corfe Mullen and parts of the{New Forest.}It costs {twelve pounds}to shoe a horse and this has to be done every six to eight weeks. The horse can be shoed hot or cold but usually cold because it is easier for Mr Laidlaw to travel to the horse than for the horse to be brought to Mr Laidlaw.
